result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory A Curtis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay a fine of $400 plus costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant.
Seek employment that doesn't interfere with programming.
Court advises the defendant he cannot possess firearms.

No violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
Do not use or possess illegally controlled substamces.

Must provide a DNA sample if not previously provided and pay the DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored. 
Random screening.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED--for the first violation--defendant to serve 5 days at the House of Correction--straight time--no good time. The second violation--defendant to serve 10 days at the House of Correction--straight time--no good time; the third violation--defendant to serve 30 days at the House of Correction--straight time--no good time; if there is a fourth violation, defendant should be revoked.

***December 9, 2014; ORDER FOR COMMITMENT TIME FOR NON-COMPLIANCE WITH PROBATION CONDITIONS;  Sheriff to take the said defendant into custody to spend 10 daus straight time for violation of probation conditions......................***

CONDITIONS:  1) no violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay a fine of $400 plus costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant; 3) do not use or possess illegally controlled substances; 4) random screening; 5) AODA, treatment or program; 6) seek employment that doesn't interfere with programming; 7) SERVE 90 DAYS at the House of Correction - STAYED - for the first violation - defendant to serve 5 days at the House of Correction - straight time - no good time;  
the second violation - defendant to serve 10 days at the House of Correction - straight time - no good time; the third violation - defendant to serve 30 days at the House of Correction - straight time - no good time;  if there is a fourth violation, defendant should be revoked. 

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge, if not already done. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copy given to the defendant.

Defendant Gregory A Curtis in court with attorney Bridget J. Krause.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson for William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.      Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel and defendant.  

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample if not previously provided and pay the DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 12 months at the House of Correction - straight time - with 4 days credit.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years.

Defendant Gregory A Curtis in court with attorney Bridget J Krause.  Nathaniel E Adamson for William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.   There is a possibility of incarceration, if so, defendant should be prepared to start serving the sentence at the next date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Gregory A Curtis in court with attorney Melissa J Fitzsimmons for Bridget Krause.  Patricia I Daugherty for William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds
  Plea hearing scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gregory A Curtis in court with attorney Bridget J Krause.  William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense is missing some discovery.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gregory A Curtis in court with attorney Bridget J Krause.  Nathaniel Adamson for William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed, no drug paraphernalia and no alcohol. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Gregory A Curtis in court with attorney Bridget J Krause.  Defendant Gregory A Curtis in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
